page.title: 05Farming
page.content: Vine Farm is a large farmhouse built in l695 by W.T.S. rebuilt in l8O5 by George Edell.Originally made of handmade bricks but has since been pebbledashed.Vine Farm has l45 acres, 8O acres is rented and the rest is owned by Mr Everatt senior who has lived here from l932. Now the land is farmed by Richard Everatt and his son David. Last year sugar beet, barley, wheat and onions grew in the fields. During July Vine Farm is locally known for its crop of strawberries. Harvest time is the busiest time of the year. Everyone has their own job e.g. combining, leading the corn and taking drinkins. Leading the corn is the transporting of wheat back to the farm and drinkins are the snack which the men get at teatime. In the winter months Vine Farm keeps cattle.
